data: Avoid Aspirin, NSAIDs, celecoxib, ticlopidine, clopidogrel, dipyridamole and sulfinpyrazone

For patient with platelet count less than 50 X 10^9/L consult hematology
- Avoid dalteparin in patients with platelet counts less than 20 x 10^9/L 
- For platelet counts between 20 x 10^9/L and 50 x 10^9/L, may administer dalteparin 100 units/kg subcutaneous daily (Hematology consult recommended)
- Transfuse patients with platelet count below 50 x 10^9/L
- Stop dalteparin / warfarin / direct oral anticoagulants (DOACs) / other anticoagulants in case of major bleeding from any site, and inform the physician immediately

Inclusion Criteria:
- 18 years of age or older
- Acute venous thrombosis
- Outpatient follow-up feasible

Exclusion Criteria:
- Clinically unstable for outpatient therapy
- Active bleeding of clinical significance requiring intervention 
- Recent GI / GU bleed (one month), hemorrhagic stroke (three months), surgery or trauma (one month). Consider consulting Hematologist for discussion
- Severe uncontrolled hypertension (systolic BP greater than or equal to 180 mmHg or diastolic BP greater than or equal to 110 mmHg)
- Platelet count less than 50 x 10^9/L (consider Hematology consult) 
- If history of Heparin-Induced Thrombocytopenia (HIT), or allergy DO NOT give low molecular weight heparin (LMWH) or heparin. 
- If eGFR less than 30 mL/min or renal failure requiring dialysis
- Liver failure with coagulopathy
- Evidence of massive ileofemoral thrombosis
- Require hospitalization for other reasons (e.g. pain control, dementia, poor social support)
- Dalteparin is contraindicated if hypersensitivity to pork products
- Hypersensitivity to Dalteparin or any of its constituents or to other low molecular weight heparins (LMWHs)
Special Authority approval (1-877-657-1188) required for outpatient Low Molecular Weight Heparin (LMWH) coverage
Stop dalteparin / warfarin / other anticoagulants in case of major bleeding from any site, and inform physician immediately
Dalteparin Treatment of Deep Vein Thrombosis (DVT) / Pulmonary Embolism (PE)

For body weight below 45 kg or greater than 145 kg please consult hematologist for dosing
Avoid Dalteparin multi-dose vials in pregnant patients
10,000 unit, subcutaneous, once, drug form: syringe-inj
12,500 unit, subcutaneous, once, drug form: syringe-inj
15,000 unit, subcutaneous, once, drug form: syringe-inj
18,000 unit, subcutaneous, once, drug form: syringe-inj
20,000 unit, subcutaneous, once, drug form: syringe-inj
22,500 unit, subcutaneous, once, drug form: syringe-inj
25,000 unit, subcutaneous, once, drug form: syringe-inj
28,000 unit, subcutaneous, once, drug form: syringe-inj
Avoid Aspirin, NSAIDs, celecoxib, ticlopidine, clopidogrel, dipyridamole and sulfinpyrazone

For patient with platelet count less than 50 X 10^9/L consult hematology
- Avoid dalteparin in patients with platelet counts less than 20 x 10^9/L 
- For platelet counts between 20 x 10^9/L and 50 x 10^9/L, may administer dalteparin 100 units/kg subcutaneous daily (Hematology consult recommended)
- Transfuse patients with platelet count below 50 x 10^9/L
- Stop dalteparin / warfarin / direct oral anticoagulants (DOACs) / other anticoagulants in case of major bleeding from any site, and inform the physician immediately

- 18 years of age or older
- Acute venous thrombosis
- Outpatient follow-up feasible

Exclusion Criteria:
- Clinically unstable for outpatient therapy
- Active bleeding of clinical significance requiring intervention 
- Recent GI / GU bleed (one month), hemorrhagic stroke (three months), surgery or trauma (one month). Consider consulting Hematologist for discussion
- Severe uncontrolled hypertension (systolic BP greater than or equal to 180 mmHg or diastolic BP greater than or equal to 110 mmHg)
- Platelet count less than 50 x 10^9/L (consider Hematology consult) 
- If history of Heparin-Induced Thrombocytopenia (HIT), or allergy DO NOT give low molecular weight heparin or heparin. 
- If eGFR less than 30 mL/min or renal failure requiring dialysis
- Liver failure with coagulopathy
- Evidence of massive ileofemoral thrombosis
- Require hospitalization for other reasons (e.g. pain control, dementia, poor social support)
- Dalteparin is contraindicated if hypersensitivity to pork products
- Hypersensitivity to Dalteparin or any of its constituents or to other low molecular weight heparins (LMWHs)
Special Authority approval (1-877-657-1188) required for outpatient Low Molecular Weight Heparin (LMWH) coverage
For body weight below 45 kg or greater than 145 kg please consult hematologist for dosing
10,000 unit, subcutaneous, qdaily, order duration: 5 day, drug form: syringe-inj, dispense qty: 5 syringe
12,500 unit, subcutaneous, qdaily, order duration: 5 day, drug form: syringe-inj, dispense qty: 5 syringe
15,000 unit, subcutaneous, qdaily, order duration: 5 day, drug form: syringe-inj, dispense qty: 5 syringe
18,000 unit, subcutaneous, qdaily, order duration: 5 day, drug form: syringe-inj, dispense qty: 5 syringe
10,000 unit, subcutaneous, q12h, order duration: 5 day, drug form: syringe-inj, dispense qty: 10 syringe
12,500 unit, subcutaneous, q12h, order duration: 5 day, drug form: syringe-inj, dispense qty: 10 syringe
For weight 101 to 115 kg, select both dalteparin prescriptions below:
10,000 unit, subcutaneous, qAM order duration: 5 day, drug form: syringe-inj, dispense qty: 5 syringe
12,500 unit, subcutaneous, qHS, order duration: 5 day, drug form: syringe-inj, dispense qty: 5 syringe
For weight 136 to 145 kg, select both dalteparin prescriptions below:
10,000 unit, subcutaneous, qAM order duration: 5 day, drug form: syringe-inj, dispense qty: 5 syringe
18,000 unit, subcutaneous, qHS, order duration: 5 day, drug form: syringe-inj, dispense qty: 5 syringe
